cyclone.name: KAREN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles southwest of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast across the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico today, then expected to continue into the western Atlantic toward the open waters south of Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico

weather_observation.warning_coast: U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), and British Virgin Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, portions of the northern Leeward Islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with higher gusts possible by late morning/afternoon Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor coastal run-up possible
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized amounts up to 8 inches, capable of flash flooding and ponding in low areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents; possible mudslides in steep terrain
